intro: Neolitsea vuquangensis, commonly known as the Vu Quang tallowtree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to the forests of northern Vietnam, particularly in the Vu Quang National Park. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape and have a smooth upper surface. It produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, round berries. Neolitsea vuquangensis plays a role in the local ecosystem, providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
